page.title: 10Badlesmere : Arable Farming
page.content: Arable farming predominates and is managed intensively with a preponderance of autumn sown crops. Of the cultivated land, 4O% is winter wheat, 2O% oilseed rape, 2O% barley, lO% grass lays and lO% other crops. Farmers aim for a lO tonne per hectare ceral crop, harvesting the corn with large combines then drying it in electronically controlled grain driers to l5% moisture for storage. Surplus grain is a problem as is surplus straw. Much is baled into half tonne round bales for bedding and fodder; the rest is ploughed in or burnt. Speed of harvesting is paramount to facilitate drilling the next crop by mid-October. Several implements are used in tandem behind a single tractor producing a seedbed and drilling the crop in a single operation.
